text: so here's some synthesized crystals of
ma vie and ba 5 is the the most popular
or the most well known moth it was the
first moth synthesized in this lab in
order to make it you would mix zinc
which is the inorganic component with
terephthalic acid the organic component
in a vial with either DMF or de up as a
solvent and after where you swirled it
and make sure we have a homogeneous
solution we're ready to put it in the
oven we'll put it in a 60 to 120 degree
oven from anywhere to several hours to
several days
after synthesizing the metal-organic
frameworks we can use powder x-ray and
single x-ray diffraction to help us
solve the structure after we determine
the structure of our materials we can
use thermo gravimetric analysis to help
us determine the heat stability of the
molecules the instrument behind me here
is an auto sort this instrument gives us
insight into this surface area and
porosity of our materials it also gives
us information about the capabilities of
our materials for a gas absorption for
carbon dioxide methane hydrogen and
other gases such as nitrogen and argon
my name is Kalyan I'm a graduate student
in the idea lab here at UCLA
